sentence.Network_en: I certainly don't begrudge him the Nobel Prize.
sentence.Network_cn: 我当然不会嫉妒他得了诺贝尔奖。

sentence.Network_en: You surely don't begrudge him his happiness.
sentence.Network_cn: 你肯定不是嫉妒他的幸福吧。

sentence.Network_en: I begrudge spending so much money on train fares.
sentence.Network_cn: 我舍不得把这么多钱花在火车票上.

list.abs: I begrudge spending so much money on buying clothes ., 我舍不得在买衣服上花这么多钱.
We don ' t begrudge your going to Italy ., 我们并不羡慕你到意大利去.
No one begrudges him his good fortune ., 无人嫉妒他的好运.
No one begrudged helping him ., 没有人不愿意帮助他.

entry.def: If you do not begrudge someone something, you do not feel angry, upset, or jealous that they have got it.

example.ex: I certainly don't begrudge him the Nobel Prize.
example.tran: 我当然不会嫉妒他得了诺贝尔奖。

entry.def: If you do not begrudge something such as time or money, you do not mind giving it up.

example.ex: I do not begrudge the money I have lost.

means.word_mean: 1. be envious of; set one's heart on

auth_sentence.content: But we do begrudge him this irritating political dodge.

means.word_mean: 嫉妒，对(某事物)感到不快或不满

sentences.cn: 他的酬劳是应得的,你别妒忌。

sentences.en: We should not begrudge our neighbour’s richness.
sentences.cn: 我们不应该嫉妒邻人的富有。
他的酬劳是应得的,你别妒忌。

means.word_mean: 勉强做；不乐意地付出；吝惜
